description:
CORRELATE CIFTI ROWS AND TAKE GRADIENT.

For each structure, compute the correlation of the rows in the structure, and take the gradients of the resulting rows, then average them.  Memory limit does not need to be an integer, you may also specify 0 to use as little memory as possible (this may be very slow).

area-metric.description:
vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the left surface

the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

anyOf.description: specify the left surface to use

left-surface.description: specify the left surface to use

area-metric.description:
vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the right surface

the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

anyOf.description: specify the right surface to use

right-surface.description: specify the right surface to use

area-metric.description:
vertex areas to use instead of computing them from the cerebellum surface

the corrected vertex areas, as a metric

anyOf.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

cerebellum-surface.description: specify the cerebellum surface to use

surface-kernel.description:
smooth on the surface before computing the gradient

the size of the gaussian surface smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

volume-kernel.description:
smooth the volume before computing the gradient

the size of the gaussian volume smoothing kernel in mm, as sigma by default

presmooth-fwhm.description: smoothing kernel sizes are FWHM, not sigma

undo-fisher-z.description: apply the inverse fisher small z transform to the input

fisher-z.description: apply the fisher small z transform to the correlations before taking the gradient

distance.description:
exclude voxels near each seed voxel from computation

distance from seed voxel for the exclusion zone, in mm

limit-GB.description:
restrict memory usage

memory limit in gigabytes

fisher-z-first.description: after the FIRST correlation, apply fisher small z transform (ie, artanh)

no-demean-first.description: instead of correlation for the FIRST operation, do dot product of rows, then normalize by diagonal

covariance-first.description: instead of correlation for the FIRST operation, compute covariance

anyOf.description: do two correlations before taking the gradient

double-correlation.description: do two correlations before taking the gradient
